item.title: Xbox Developer Direct Announced for January 23
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/xbox-developer-direct-announced-for-january-23/

Xbox’s upcoming Developer Direct has been announced. It will arrive on January 23 at 10 am Pacific / 1 pm Eastern / 6 pm UK. 

This year’s Xbox Developer Direct will provide players with a detailed look at the games they have to offer for Xbox Series X/S, PC and Game Pass in 2025. Developers such as Compulsion Games, Sandfall Interactive and id Studios will join the fray to reveal more information about South of Midnight, Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 and DOOM: The Dark Ages, respectively.

How to Watch Xbox Developer Direct 2025?

Xbox Developer Direct 2025 will be live-streamed across all Xbox social channels on January 23 at 10 am PT / 1 pm ET / 6 pm UK. 

  • Youtube
  • Twitch

What to Expect from Xbox Developer Direct 2025

Doom: The Dark Ages

iD studio will finally give players a full reveal for Doom: The Dark Ages. The upcoming title is a prequel to the original series and will become the franchise’s third instalment. 

South of Midnight

Compulsion Games will provide a glimpse into their upcoming third-person action-adventure, South of Midnight. The title is set in the American Deep South, where you encounter creatures inspired by Southern Folklore. 

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 

Lastly, Sandfall Interactive will discuss how Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 was created with some behind-the-scenes details and “how they plan to deliver an incredible story in a gorgeous fantasy world.”

Surprise Game

Xbox also has a secret game up their sleeves, and they will be visiting “a surprise location to see another studio’s brand new game”.

In other news, Microsoft will combine ‘Xbox and Windows’ to enhance their handheld experience. Also, check out the Game Pass titles for this month. What are your thoughts on this year’s Xbox Developer Direct? Let us know in the comments or our community forum!

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about Sony’s new future immersive The Last of Us concept project. Don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Transformers Reactivate Gameplay Leaks Online Following Cancellation
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/transformers-reactivate-gameplay/

Transformers Reactivate gameplay leaked online after Splash Damage announced the game would be canceled.

Uploading by the X (formerly Twitter) account @DpzLuna, six and half minutes of footage reveal what the game would have been like. According to the watermarks, the footage was captured on March 28, 2023. You can watch the gameplay below:

The footage shows the player driving around in a car and seamessly transforming into a transformer to battle enemies.

Just yesterday, Splash Damage announced that Transformers Reactivate would be canceled and that a number of roles at the company are at risk of redundancy. Splash Damage said the company would “refocus” on some of its other projects.

“While not being able to see the game through to release is painful, having to say goodbye to friends and colleagues hurts even more,” they said. “We’re now focused on doing everything we can to support them through this tough period, just as we are committed to caring for those who will stay with us as we build a stronger Splash Damage for the future.”

Transformers Reactivate was first announced on December 8, 2022, and little about the game has been heard since then.

It’s currently unclear how many roles at Splash Damage have been affected, but Insider Gaming has contacted Splash Damage for comment.

What do you think of the Transformers Reactivate gameplay? Let us know in the comment, or join the discussion on our community forum!

For more Insider Gaming, check out when you can likely expect the next Pokemon Presents showcase, or Marvel Rivals Season 1 Patch Notes. And don’t forget to sign up for our newsletter.
